intro: Orobus articulatus, commonly known as the jointed orobus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or white. The species is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical study remains limited.
